inputs.selection_motivation: US Services PMI is a leading indicator; its influence on unemployment claims is weak and lagging, making that link the least valuable for real‑time analysis.

prioritized_link.motivation: US Services PMI is a leading indicator of economic expansion; a robust PMI reading typically signals the Fed will consider a rate cut to sustain growth, making it a direct driver of the Sept 17 2025 rate cut.

source_node.query: (US stocks OR US equities OR US market OR U.S. stocks OR U.S. equities OR U.S. market OR Wall Street OR equities OR market OR stock market OR stocks OR equity) AND (pullback OR reversal OR sell-off OR decline OR weakness OR downside OR market decline OR market pullback) AND (Nasdaq OR NDX OR NASDAQ OR SPX OR S&P 500 OR S&P500 OR DJIA OR DOW OR Dow Jones OR Dow) AND (Trump OR tariffs OR tariff OR trade OR trade concerns OR trade war OR movie tariffs OR film tariffs OR Hollywood) AND (Xi OR Xi Jinping OR US-China trade OR US China trade OR trade deal) AND (ISM OR ISM services PMI OR services PMI OR PMI OR service sector) AND (energy OR oil OR crude OR OPEC OR OPEC+ OR oil prices OR oil stocks) AND (telecom OR telecom stocks) AND (airline OR airline stocks) AND (gold OR gold stocks) AND (overseas OR Asia-Pacific OR APAC OR Australia OR ASX OR India OR Nifty OR Europe OR UK OR Germany OR DAX OR France OR CAC 40) AND (bond OR Treasury OR US Treasury OR 10-year note OR 10-year yield OR yield OR bond yields) AND (news OR update OR analysis OR trend OR market movement OR report)
source_node.motivation: The article reports a new reading of the US ISM Services PMI at 51.6 for April, providing a timely macro driver that can influence equity, credit, and rate markets.
source_node.name: US Services PMI
source_node.importance_rationale: US Services PMI is a key macroeconomic driver that influences a wide range of markets—interest rates, equity indices, credit spreads, and FX. It is a timely indicator with short‑to‑medium horizon impact, fitting the "driver" category that typically receives importance 2. It is not a structural anchor (hence not 5) and is clearly market relevant, so it should not be removed.
